text:
I grew up in a small town in the Midwest. It was a quiet and peaceful place, but it was far from perfect. My childhood was filled with a lot of hard work and struggles, but it was also filled with moments of joy and love. 

My parents were hard-working people who worked in the factory, and I remember that they were always exhausted when they came home from work. Despite their hard work, we didn't have a lot of money. We were always stretching to make ends meet, but my parents never let us down. 

I had two older sisters, and we all shared a bedroom. We had to take turns sleeping because there wasn't enough room for all of us in one bed. My parents didn't have a lot of time to spend with us, so it was up to my sisters and I to look after ourselves. We had to make sure that our room was clean and that we were doing our homework and chores. 

My sisters and I were close, and we would often play together. We didn't have a lot of toys, so we had to get creative with our play. We would make up stories, play pretend, and invent games. We also would play tag in the fields near our house, explore the woods, and ride our bikes around the neighborhood. 

My parents had a garden, and we would help them plant it every year. We would dig up the soil and put in the seeds and water them every day. When the vegetables were ready, we would pick them and help my parents cook them. 

My parents also taught us how to be responsible and to take care of ourselves. They taught us how to do our own laundry and how to cook simple meals. They encouraged us to read, and we had to read a certain number of books each month. 

On the weekends, we would often go to the lake for a picnic and a swim. We would also go camping, and my parents would teach us how to build a fire, how to cook over an open flame, and how to identify plants and animals in the woods. 

My parents also taught us the importance of education. They made sure that we were doing our homework and studying for our tests. They would also take us to the library and encourage us to read and learn about the world. 

My childhood was filled with a lot of hard work, but it was also filled with a lot of love. We may not have had a lot of money or material things, but my parents made sure that we had enough time and attention. They taught us how to be responsible, how to work hard, and how to appreciate the little things in life.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.
